com.baristamatic.drink.menu
Interface Menu

All Known Implementing Classes:
SingleBaristaDrinkMenu
public interface Menu

This interface provides access to a menu of featured drinks on the Baristamatic Simulator user control panel.

Version:
1.0, 09/15/11
Author:
Tom Stewart 
seasonedgeek@mac.com

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getFeaturedDrinksMenu(boolean noPrompt)
          Returns optional instructions on how to select a featured drink on the menu, or replenish an inventory of ingredients, or exit the application.
 void setDrinkAttributes(java.lang.String drinkName, java.lang.String drinkCost)
          Subclasses, should call this method, once per featured drink during initialization, after instantiation.
 void updateMenuDrinkAvailability(java.lang.String drinkName, boolean inStock)
          Subclasses, should call this method, frequently during business hours, to update the availability of a named drink offered on a menu.
 

Method Detail

getFeaturedDrinksMenu

java.lang.String getFeaturedDrinksMenu(boolean noPrompt)
Returns optional instructions on how to select a featured drink on the menu, or replenish an inventory of ingredients, or exit the application.

Parameters:
noPrompt - A boolean, when true includes prompt, else false excludes it.
Returns:
String A formatted String element.

setDrinkAttributes

void setDrinkAttributes(java.lang.String drinkName,
                        java.lang.String drinkCost)
Subclasses, should call this method, once per featured drink during initialization, after instantiation.

Parameters:
drinkName - A String element, identifies the drink by name.
drinkCost - A formatted String element, such as $N.NN, the cost of a drink.

updateMenuDrinkAvailability

void updateMenuDrinkAvailability(java.lang.String drinkName,
                                 boolean inStock)
Subclasses, should call this method, frequently during business hours, to update the availability of a named drink offered on a menu.

Parameters:
drinkName - A String element, identifies the drink by name.
inStock - A boolean value, when true is in-stock, else false is out-of-stock.
